co2api

Class Public<T extends ContractModel>

  • java.lang.Object
    • co2api.Public<T>

  • public class Public<T extends ContractModel>
extends java.lang.Object
    A public contract is a contract published by the middleware. It is composed by a contract (belonging to a specific contract model) and a valid connection to the middleware.
    Version:
    1.3.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Podda, Livio Pompianu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Public(CO2ServerConnection connection, java.lang.String uniqueID, T contract)
      Creates a new Public contract.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Public<T> accept()
      This method must be used for accept a contract published on the web (in the contract server).
      T getContract()
      Returns the contract object
      Session<T> getSession()
      A non-blocking API that if the contract is fused returns a Session object for further operations, like send and receive.
      java.lang.String getUniqueID()
      Returns the uniqueID
      java.lang.Boolean isFused()
      Use this method for checking if a previously published contract is already fused (with another) or not.
      void setConnection(CO2ServerConnection c)
      Sets the object that handles the connection to the middleware.
      Session<T> waitForSession()
      A blocking API that stops your application until your contract is fused and the corresponding session is started.
      Session<T> waitForSession(java.lang.Integer msecs)
      A blocking API that stops your application until your contract is fused and the corresponding session is started: you can specify a maximum time for wait.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Public

        public Public(CO2ServerConnection connection,
              java.lang.String uniqueID,
              T contract)
        Creates a new Public contract.
        Parameters:
        connection - Valid connection to the middleware
        uniqueID - Hash of the contract returned by the middleware
        contract - The contract object

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        public Public<T> accept()
                 throws ContractException
        This method must be used for accept a contract published on the web (in the contract server). If the request succeeds, it automatically stores the hash to be used for further operations (example: performing actions).
        Returns:
        A public contract to be used for further operation
        Throws:
        ContractException - In case of errors, for more informations check the exception message

      • getContract

        public T getContract()
        Returns the contract object
        Returns:
        The contract object

      • getUniqueID

        public java.lang.String getUniqueID()
        Returns the uniqueID
        Returns:
        The uniqueID

      • setConnection

        public void setConnection(CO2ServerConnection c)
        Sets the object that handles the connection to the middleware.
        Parameters:
        c - the connection to be used

      • isFused

        public java.lang.Boolean isFused()
                          throws ContractException
        Use this method for checking if a previously published contract is already fused (with another) or not.
        Returns:
        True if contract is already fused, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ContractException - In case of errors, for more informations check the exception message

      • getSession

        public Session<T> getSession()
                      throws ContractException
        A non-blocking API that if the contract is fused returns a Session object for further operations, like send and receive.
        Returns:
        The Session object
        Throws:
        ContractException - In case of errors, for more informations check the exception message

      • waitForSession

        public Session<T> waitForSession()
                          throws ContractException
        A blocking API that stops your application until your contract is fused and the corresponding session is started.
        Returns:
        The session if it is started (still waits otherwise)
        Throws:
        ContractException - In case of errors, for more informations check the exception message

      • waitForSession

        public Session<T> waitForSession(java.lang.Integer msecs)
                          throws ContractException,
                                 TimeExpiredException
        A blocking API that stops your application until your contract is fused and the corresponding session is started: you can specify a maximum time for wait.
        Parameters:
        msecs - The timeout until the call die (in milliseconds)
        Returns:
        The session if it is started. If time expires (or errors occur), returns an exception
        Throws:
        ContractException - In case of errors, for more informations check the exception message
        TimeExpiredException - When the time specified si expired without obtain a session
